titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A. Cooke Hull election petition and memorial book ARC.243
titlestmt.author: Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:13:25 +0000.

did.unittitle: A. Cooke Hull election petition and memorial book

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Brooklyn (New York, N.Y.). Board of Education

did.abstract: This collection contains a petition endorsing A. Cooke Hull as a candidate for alderman of Brooklyn's Third Ward, dated 1865, and a memorial book for Hull, presented on July 7, 1868 by the Board of Education of the City of Brooklyn.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
The collection combines the accessions 1978.022 and 1979.014.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); A. Cooke Hull election petition and memorial book, ARC.243, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains a petition endorsing A. Cooke Hull as a candidate for alderman of Brooklyn's Third Ward, dated 1865, and a memorial book for Hull, presented on July 7, 1868 by the Board of Education of the City of Brooklyn.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. A. Cooke Hull (1818-1868) was a resident of Brooklyn, a physician, a trustee of Public Schools 8 and 11 in Brooklyn, and a founder of the Long Island Historical Society (now the Brooklyn Historical Society).

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Accession 1978.022 was purchased from Cedric L. Robinson Booksellers, 1978. The source and date of acquisition for accession 1979.014 are not known.
